snippet: Even as the breakfast showcased the “new” multicultural Boston, the traditional St. Patrick’s Day parade, which barred openly gay marchers, was a reminder of the “old” Boston that still exists.
abstract: Massachusetts State Senator Linda Dorcena Forry hosts annual St Patrick's Day breakfast in South Boston, first time a nonmale, nonwhite, nonresident has been the master of ceremonies of the signature cultural event; while the performance showcases the 'new' multicultural Boston, parade that follows was reminder of the the 'old' Boston, as gays were not allowed to march if they proclaimed their sexual orientation.
lead_paragraph: Even as the breakfast showcased the “new” multicultural Boston, the traditional St. Patrick’s Day parade, which barred openly gay marchers, was a reminder of the “old” Boston that still exists.

headline.main: Boston’s St. Patrick’s Day Breakfast Breaks Barriers, but Its Parade Does Not
headline.print_headline: Boston’s St. Patrick’s Day Breakfast Breaks Barriers, but Its Parade Does Not
